SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Security Checks relative to Political Disruptions?
SRP.A: Security Checks is {above} Political Disruptions in the vertical direction.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the largest portion to the total cross-border delays?
VPR.A: The series with the largest contribution is {Security Checks}.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the smallest portion to the total cross-border delays?
VPR.A: The series with the smallest contribution is {Weather Impacts}.

VE.A: Documentation Errors's cross-border delays in 2010 is {13.41} hours.

VE.Q: What is Political Disruptions's Cross-Border Delays in 2020?
VE.A: Political Disruptions's cross-border delays in 2020 is {18.63} hours.

VE.Q: What are the cross-border delays of Weather Impacts, Sanitary Inspections, and Political Disruptions in 2020?
VE.A: Weather Impacts's cross-border delays is {8.15} hours, Sanitary Inspections's cross-border delays is {21.74} hours, Political Disruptions's cross-border delays is {18.63} hours.

EVJ.Q: What is the global minimum Cross-Border Delays in the area chart?
EVJ.A: The global minimum cross-border delays is {8.15} hours.

EVJ.Q: What is the global maximum Cross-Border Delays in the area chart?
EVJ.A: The global maximum cross-border delays is {32.43} hours.

EVJ.A: Documentation Errors reached approximately {19.82} hours in {2019}.

EVJ.Q: What is the lowest Cross-Border Delays level recorded for Documentation Errors?

SC.Q: What is the average total Cross-Border Delays?
SC.A: The average total cross-border delays is {78.63} hours.

NC.Q: Between 2011 and 2019, was the average total Cross-Border Delays higher or lower than between 2013 and 2016?
NC.A: The average total cross-border delays between 2011 and 2019 was {higher} than between 2013 and 2016.

NC.Q: Was the total Cross-Border Delays in 2018 higher or lower than in 2020?
NC.A: The total cross-border delays in 2018 was {lower} than in 2020.

NC.Q: Was the total Cross-Border Delays in 2011 higher or lower than in 2014?
NC.A: The total cross-border delays in 2011 was {lower} than in 2014.

NC.Q: Was the total Cross-Border Delays in 2010 higher or lower than in 2017?
NC.A: The total cross-border delays in 2010 was {lower} than in 2017.

MSR.A: {Security Checks} has the largest cumulative area.

VA.Q: To reduce the 'waving' visual effect in the area chart, reorder the layers by end value and list the labels from top to bottom after sorting.
VA.A: The reordered layer order from top to bottom is: {Weather Impacts, Documentation Errors, Political Disruptions, Sanitary Inspections, Security Checks}.
